title: Adjustments of Certain Rates of Pay

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates the salary rates and pay schedules for various federal employees, including those in statutory pay systems, senior executives, judges, military personnel, and others. It sets new pay adjustments effective in 2022 and supersedes the previous similar order from 2020.
potential_concerns: Increased pay rates may strain federal budgets if not offset by appropriations or other savings.
Delays or errors in implementing new pay schedules could cause payroll disruption or employee dissatisfaction.
Differences in pay adjustments among various schedules may lead to perceptions of unfairness or inequity among federal employees.
Locality-based comparability payments could be controversial if perceived as favoring certain regions over others.
Superseding prior orders may require coordination to ensure smooth transition without gaps in pay adjustments.
